an6.16:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Bhaggas on Crocodile Hill, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.
an6.16:4.2: Now at that time the householder Nakula’s father was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
an6.16:4.3: Then the housewife Nakula’s mother said to him:
an6.16:5.1: “Householder, when the time comes to die, don’t be concerned.
an6.16:5.3: and it’s criticized by the Buddha.
an6.16:5.5: ‘When I’ve gone, the housewife Nakula’s mother won’t be able to provide for the children and keep up the household carpets.’
an6.16:5.6: But you should not see it like this.
an6.16:5.7: I’m skilled at spinning cotton and carding wool.
an6.16:5.8: I’m able to provide for the children and keep up the household carpets.
an6.16:5.9: So householder, when the time comes to die, don’t be concerned …
an6.16:6.2: ‘When I’ve gone, the housewife Nakula’s mother will take another husband.’
an6.16:6.3: But you should not see it like this.
an6.16:6.4: Both you and I know that we have remained celibate while at home for the past sixteen years.
an6.16:6.5: So householder, when the time comes to die, don’t be concerned …
an6.16:7.2: ‘When I’ve gone, the housewife Nakula’s mother won’t want to see the Buddha and his Saṅgha of mendicants.’
an6.16:7.3: But you should not see it like this.
an6.16:7.4: When you’ve gone, I’ll want to see the Buddha and his mendicant Saṅgha even more.
an6.16:7.5: So householder, when the time comes to die, don’t be concerned …
an6.16:8.2: ‘The housewife Nakula’s mother won’t fulfill ethics.’
an6.16:8.3: But you should not see it like this.
an6.16:8.4: I am one of those white-robed disciples of the Buddha who fulfills their ethics.
an6.16:8.5: Whoever doubts this can go and ask the Buddha.
an6.16:8.6: He is staying in the land of the Bhaggas on Crocodile Hill, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.
an6.16:8.8: So householder, when the time comes to die, don’t be concerned …
an6.16:9.2: ‘The housewife Nakula’s mother doesn’t have internal serenity of heart.’
an6.16:9.3: But you should not see it like this.
an6.16:9.4: I am one of those white-robed disciples of the Buddha who has internal serenity of heart.
an6.16:9.5: Whoever doubts this can go and ask the Buddha.
an6.16:9.6: He is staying in the land of the Bhaggas on Crocodile Hill, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.
an6.16:9.8: So householder, when the time comes to die, don’t be concerned …
an6.16:10.2: ‘The housewife Nakula’s mother has not gained a basis, a firm basis, and self-confidence in this teaching and training. She has not gone beyond doubt, got rid of uncertainty, and gained assurance. And she’s not independent of others in the Teacher’s instructions.’
an6.16:10.3: But you should not see it like this.
an6.16:10.4: I am one of those white-robed disciples of the Buddha who has gained a basis, a firm basis, and self-confidence in this teaching and training. I have gone beyond doubt, got rid of uncertainty, and gained assurance. And I am independent of others in the Teacher’s instructions.’
an6.16:10.5: Whoever doubts this can go and ask the Buddha.
an6.16:10.6: He is staying in the land of the Bhaggas on Crocodile Hill, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.
an6.16:10.8: So householder, when the time comes to die, don’t be concerned.
an6.16:10.10: and it’s criticized by the Buddha.”
an6.16:11.1: And then, as Nakula’s mother was giving this advice to Nakula’s father, his illness died down on the spot.
an6.16:11.2: And that’s how Nakula’s father recovered from that illness.
an6.16:11.4: Soon after recovering, leaning on a staff he went to the Buddha,
an6.16:11.5: bowed and sat down to one side.
an6.16:12.2: to have the housewife Nakula’s mother advise and instruct you out of kindness and compassion.
an6.16:12.3: She is one of those white-robed disciples of the Buddha who fulfills their ethics.
an6.16:12.4: She is one of those white-robed disciples of the Buddha who has internal serenity of heart.
an6.16:12.5: She is one of those white-robed disciples of the Buddha who has gained a basis, a firm basis, and self-confidence in this teaching and training. She has gone beyond doubt, got rid of uncertainty, and gained assurance. And she is independent of others in the Teacher’s instructions.
an6.16:12.6: You’re fortunate, householder, so very fortunate,
an6.16:12.7: to have the housewife Nakula’s mother advise and instruct you out of kindness and compassion.”
